intro: Serratula behen, commonly known as blessed thistle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has finely serrated leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Serratula behen is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
